page.title: 19M1 Tinsley Viaduct Sheffield
page.content: In Feb. 1965 the Transport Ministry announced the design for the two level elevated structure which carries the M1 Motorway on the upper level and an all purpose Trunk Road on the lower. The viaduct spans the Don Valley at Sheffield crossing the Sheffield - Keadby Canal, the Don and a network of railways. The 3388ft. long viaduct is divided into 20 spans supporting two levels by a box girder construction. Subsequent investigation found this type of structure to be defective, consequently the viaduct was partially closed upon its completion in 1969. Strengthening tests resulted in inverted triangular trusses supporting the upper deck. Although the cost has risen from an estimated Â£4m. to over Â£10m. the viaduct is still not fully operational.
